squat.name: Back Squat
squat.description: Fundamental lower body compound movement involving hip and knee flexion

knee_angle.measurement: Angle between hip-knee-ankle at bottom position
knee_angle.source: NSCA Essentials of Strength Training, 4th Ed

back_angle.measurement: Spine alignment from thoracic to lumbar (neutral spine)
back_angle.source: McGill S. Low Back Disorders, 3rd Ed

knee_tracking.standard: Knees must track in line with toes (2nd-3rd toe direction)
knee_tracking.measurement: Medial-lateral knee displacement relative to foot position
knee_tracking.safe_deviation: < 2cm medial or lateral from toe line

depth.full_squat: Hip crease below top of knee (thigh parallel or below)
depth.measurement: Vertical position of hip crease relative to knee

bar_path.standard: Vertical line over mid-foot throughout movement

common_errors.detection: Knee medial displacement > 2cm during descent/ascent
common_errors.risk: ACL injury, meniscus damage, patellofemoral pain syndrome
common_errors.correction: Cue: 'Push knees out'. Strengthen hip abductors (glute medius). Reduce load by 20-30%.
common_errors.source: Hewett TE et al. Biomechanical Measures of Neuromuscular Control (2005)

common_errors.error: Butt wink (posterior pelvic tilt at bottom)
common_errors.detection: Lumbar spine flexion > 10 degrees at depth
common_errors.risk: Disc herniation, lower back strain, sacroiliac joint pain
common_errors.correction: Reduce depth to parallel. Improve hip flexor flexibility. Strengthen core stability.
common_errors.source: McGill S. Ultimate Back Fitness and Performance

common_errors.detection: Torso angle < 45 degrees from vertical (high bar) or < 30 degrees (low bar)
common_errors.risk: Lower back injury, inefficient force transfer, balance loss
common_errors.correction: Check bar position on back. Strengthen core and upper back. Improve ankle mobility.

common_errors.detection: Heel vertical displacement > 1cm during movement
common_errors.risk: Knee stress, balance instability, Achilles tendon strain
common_errors.correction: Improve ankle dorsiflexion mobility. Widen stance slightly. Use heel wedge temporarily.

common_errors.detection: Knee position > 5cm anterior to toes at bottom
common_errors.correction: Sit back more into hips. Cue: 'Push hips back first'. Check ankle mobility.

powerlifting.depth_requirement: Hip crease must break parallel (below knee)

olympic_weightlifting.mobility_priority: Extreme ankle and hip mobility required

beginner.priority: Perfect form over depth or load

injury_history.knee_issues: Limit depth to 100 degrees knee angle minimum
injury_history.back_issues: Maintain stricter back angle requirement (> 170 degrees)

deadlift.name: Conventional Deadlift
deadlift.description: Hip hinge pattern for posterior chain development, foundational strength movement

back_angle.measurement: Neutral spine angle throughout entire lift
back_angle.source: McGill S. Ultimate Back Fitness and Performance

hip_angle_start.measurement: Hip hinge angle at starting position

shoulder_position.standard: Shoulders directly over or slightly ahead of barbell (1-2cm)
shoulder_position.measurement: Shoulder joint vertical position relative to bar

bar_path.standard: Perfectly vertical path, bar maintains contact with legs

grip_width.standard: Hands just outside legs, arms completely vertical
grip_width.measurement: Grip width allows arms to clear thighs without interference

common_errors.detection: Back angle < 170 degrees, visible rounding in lumbar spine
common_errors.risk: Disc herniation, severe spinal injury, chronic back pain
common_errors.correction: STOP IMMEDIATELY. Reduce weight 40-50%. Reset form. Strengthen erector spinae.
common_errors.source: McGill S. Low Back Injury Research

common_errors.detection: Hip extension occurs before knee extension
common_errors.risk: Excessive back loading, inefficient mechanics, back strain
common_errors.correction: Cue: 'Push floor away'. Start with hips slightly higher. Strengthen posterior chain.

common_errors.detection: Horizontal bar displacement > 3cm from vertical path
common_errors.risk: Increased moment arm on spine, back injury, bicep tear risk
common_errors.correction: Cue: 'Drag bar up legs'. Keep lats engaged. Check starting position.

common_errors.detection: Shoulder joint posterior to bar vertical line
common_errors.correction: Shift weight forward. Push knees out. Get shoulders over bar.

common_errors.detection: Back angle > 190 degrees, excessive lean backward
common_errors.correction: Cue: 'Stand tall, neutral spine'. Strengthen core. Don't lean back.

common_errors.detection: Rapid acceleration at start, loss of tension
common_errors.risk: Bicep tear, back injury, failed lift
common_errors.correction: Cue: 'Pull slack out of bar first'. Create tension before lift.

powerlifting.lockout_requirement: Knees and hips fully extended, shoulders back
powerlifting.hitching: Not allowed (bar must move in continuous motion)

beginner.starting_recommendation: Trap bar deadlift or Romanian deadlift first

pushup.name: Push-up
pushup.description: Fundamental upper body pressing movement, closed kinetic chain exercise

body_alignment.standard: Straight line from head through hips to ankles (plank position)
body_alignment.measurement: Hip vertical deviation from shoulder-ankle line

hand_position.standard: Hands slightly wider than shoulder width, fingers forward

depth.standard: Chest within 5cm of ground or touching

neck_position.standard: Neutral cervical spine, head in line with body

common_errors.detection: Hip position > 5cm below shoulder-ankle line
common_errors.correction: Engage core. Cue: 'Squeeze glutes and abs'. Regress to knees or incline.

common_errors.detection: Hip position > 5cm above shoulder-ankle line
common_errors.correction: Lower hips to plank position. Strengthen core stability.

common_errors.detection: Elbow angle relative to torso > 70 degrees
common_errors.correction: Tuck elbows to 45 degrees. Cue: 'Break bar apart'. Strengthen rotator cuff.

common_errors.detection: Elbow angle at bottom > 100 degrees
common_errors.risk: Reduced training effectiveness, poor movement pattern
common_errors.correction: Lower chest to within 5cm of ground. Regress to incline if needed.

common_errors.detection: Medial border of scapula lifts > 2cm off ribcage
common_errors.correction: Focus on protraction at top. Strengthen serratus anterior. Regress exercise.

common_errors.detection: Cervical spine not neutral (flexed or extended > 10 degrees)
common_errors.correction: Look at spot 30cm ahead on ground. Keep neck neutral.

beginner.regression: Incline pushup (hands elevated) or knee pushup

advanced.progressions: Deficit pushup, weighted vest, single-arm progression

shoulder_injury.hand_width: Narrow grip to reduce shoulder stress

pullup.name: Pull-up / Chin-up
pullup.description: Vertical pulling movement for back and arm development

shoulder_position_bottom.standard: Active hang - scapulae depressed, shoulders packed
shoulder_position_bottom.measurement: Shoulder elevation relative to relaxed hang

completion_criteria.standard: Chin clears bar (chin-up) or chest touches bar (pull-up)

grip_width.pullup: Slightly wider than shoulder width, pronated grip

common_errors.detection: Shoulders elevated toward ears at bottom position
common_errors.correction: Engage lats at bottom. Cue: 'Depress and retract scapulae'. Active hang always.

common_errors.detection: Body swing > 15 degrees from vertical
common_errors.risk: Shoulder injury, grip failure, ineffective training
common_errors.correction: Eliminate momentum. Use bands for assistance. Build strict pull-up strength.

common_errors.detection: Chin does not clear bar or elbows not fully extended at bottom
common_errors.risk: Reduced training effectiveness, poor movement pattern
common_errors.correction: Full ROM requirement. Use assistance if needed (bands, machine).

common_errors.detection: Cervical extension > 15 degrees to clear bar
common_errors.correction: Pull chest to bar, not chin. Keep neck neutral.

common_errors.detection: Elbows moving laterally during pull
common_errors.correction: Cue: 'Pull elbows to ribs'. Engage lats throughout.

beginner.regression: Assisted pull-up machine, band assistance, or negative reps

advanced.progressions: Weighted pull-ups, L-sit pull-ups, one-arm progressions

lunge.name: Forward Lunge
lunge.description: Unilateral lower body movement pattern for leg strength and balance

front_knee_angle.measurement: Front leg knee angle at bottom position

front_knee_position.standard: Knee directly over ankle, not past toes

rear_knee_position.standard: Rear knee hovers 2-5cm above ground at bottom
rear_knee_position.measurement: Vertical distance from rear knee to ground

hip_alignment.standard: Hips square, no lateral deviation or rotation

common_errors.detection: Knee > 5cm anterior to toes at bottom
common_errors.correction: Longer stride length. Sit back into front hip. Shift weight to heel.

common_errors.detection: Rear knee contacts ground with force
common_errors.correction: Control descent. Stop 2-5cm above ground. Strengthen quadriceps.

common_errors.detection: Torso angle < 75 degrees from horizontal
common_errors.correction: Keep chest up. Engage core. Shorten stride if needed.

common_errors.detection: Front knee collapsing medially > 2cm
common_errors.correction: Cue: 'Push knee out over 2nd toe'. Strengthen hip abductors.

common_errors.detection: One hip elevated > 2cm or rotation > 5 degrees
common_errors.risk: Hip strain, sacroiliac dysfunction, balance issues
common_errors.correction: Focus on hip square positioning. Address hip mobility imbalances.

common_errors.detection: Front knee angle > 110 degrees at bottom
common_errors.correction: Increase stride length. Front knee should be ~90 degrees.

beginner.recommendation: Static split squat first, then progress to lunge
beginner.assistance: Use TRX or wall for balance support

advanced.variations: Walking lunges, reverse lunges, weighted lunges, Bulgarian split squat

knee_injury.modification: Reverse lunge (less knee stress) or step-up

body_alignment.standard: Straight line from head through shoulders, hips, knees, to ankles
body_alignment.measurement: Hip vertical deviation from shoulder-ankle line

neck_position.standard: Neutral cervical spine, gaze at floor 30cm ahead

common_errors.detection: Hips > 5cm below shoulder-ankle line
common_errors.correction: Engage core and glutes. Shorten hold time. Regress to knees.

common_errors.detection: Hips > 5cm above shoulder-ankle line
common_errors.correction: Lower hips to neutral. May indicate weak core - regress exercise.

common_errors.detection: Scapulae protruding from back
common_errors.correction: Push floor away with forearms. Strengthen serratus anterior.

common_errors.detection: Cervical flexion or extension > 10 degrees
common_errors.correction: Neutral neck, look at floor 30cm ahead.

beginner.regression: Plank on knees or incline plank

advanced.progressions: Weighted plank, single-arm/leg plank, RKC plank
advanced.duration: Focus on tension quality over duration (60s max)

assessment_priority.description: Spinal position violations, joint angles indicating immediate injury risk
Knee valgus, excessive joint stress, unstable positions

measurement_tolerance.description: Account for individual variation and measurement error

context_considerations: Fatigue state (early vs late in set)

citation_requirements.always_cite: Every safety standard mentioned must include the source
citation_requirements.measurement_format: Always provide measured value and standard (e.g., 'Knee angle: 82° - Standard: ≥90°')
citation_requirements.severity_labeling: Use CRITICAL, HIGH, MEDIUM, LOW based on injury risk
citation_requirements.evidence_based: All recommendations must be grounded in these documented standards
